Summary Senior Business Professional with over 8 years experience in the Technology and Financial markets.  
 
I spent five years at my first company, FXCM, working with SMB to Enterprise Clients selling a cloud platform for financial instrument trading. I helped our company grow for 4 years before we IPO'ed in 2010, becoming one of the first publicly traded FX brokerages.  
 
In 2011 I moved into the Tech / Information Technology Market and took a position at a then small San Francisco based start-up called Meraki. I broke ground in our APAC territory, a region that I knew very well from my prior work. In early 2013 Meraki was acquired by Cisco Systems for $1.2 billion.

Summary Sarah Edwards is Managing Director and owner of Capital Network Solutions Limited (www.capitalnetworks.co.uk) based in Bristol and Cardiff. CNS is a specialist provider of advanced network services, cyber security and managed support services to global organisations and maintains partnerships with industry leaders such as Cisco, Meraki, Barracuda, Safenet, Dell, HP and Microsoft. With a strong level of expertise in cybercrime, ethical hacking and advanced network penetration testing, CNS is one of a select number of IASME Cyber Essentials certification bodies within the UK. 
Sarah is passionate about business enablement using new and emerging technologies to bring about increased productivity, enhanced security and cost containment. Key areas of expertise include emerging technology adoption, business enablement and strategy and solution implementation. Cisco / Meraki product specialist Ingram Micro May 2014  –  April 2015  (1 year) As a product specialist targeted on profit and revenue within the Cisco business at Ingram I have exceeded profit, revenue and margin targets every month since my start in May and am on course to exceed again this month. 
I have delivered YOY revenue growth of almost 300% against a set of Cisco accounts in the 11 months I have been here. 
I have built a strong relationship with Cisco leveraging their account managers to help close and win business for Ingram Micro, more notable I turned around a failing relationship with Meraki which resulted in over £500,000 of incremental business to IMUK at 7% + hard margin.

Senior Account Manager Avnet Technology Solutions August 2011  –  December 2012  (1 year 5 months) Account manager with internal and external responsibilities for 13 key accounts with a GP target of around £1m per anum.

I would write and execute growth plans for specific accounts and vendors whilst meanwhile tracking slippage and implement win back strategies where necessary

Summary I am a recent graduate of Champlain College, having received a Bachelor of Science in Computer Networking and Information Security, with a focus on Cyber Security and Systems Administration.  
 
My technical experience began at an early age as I played on my parents' Windows 95 machine. I started studying computers and technology in the Academy for Information Technology program at Questar III during my junior and senior years of high school. My positive experiences, both academically and while performing tasks around the school in an internship role, led me to continue my studies with a professional commitment to computer networking.  
 
At Hudson Valley Community College, I spent two semesters rounding-out my knowledge and experience, taking courses in programming, web development, and computer theory. After successfully completing my first year at Hudson Valley with a 4.0 GPA, I transferred to Champlain College.  
 
During my time at Champlain College, I spent three years further augmenting my technical knowledge through classes focusing on computer networking fundamentals, server and network administration, as well as cyber security and information assurance. Additionally, I had the opportunity to increase my awareness and understanding of topics such as human rights, Chinese history and culture, and the philosophical ideologies that shape the structure of modern society. Finally, I was able to acquire a wealth of professional experience through my internships with Bowl New England, Frog Hollow, Marathon Health, and Google. 
 
My goal going forward is to learn as much as possible and gain a strong, well-rounded background in computers and networking, while augmenting my academic knowledge with professional experience to produce a strong foundation that will facilitate professional and personal success over the course of my career and lifetime.
